sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using matrix methods
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using matrix methods:

3x + 2y = 14

5x - 4y = 28
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using matrix methods, we will first represent the system as an augmented matrix:

```
[ 3  2 | 14 ]
[ 5 -4 | 28 ]
```

Now, we will perform row operations to get the matrix in row-echelon form. We will start by making the element in the first row and first column equal to 1. To do this, we can divide the first row by 3:

```
[ 1  2/3 | 14/3 ]
[ 5 -4  | 28   ]
```

Next, we will make the element in the second row and first column equal to 0. To do this, we can subtract 5 times the first row from the second row:

```
[ 1  2/3 |  14/3 ]
[ 0 -22/3 |  10   ]
```

Now, we will make the element in the second row and second column equal to 1. To do this, we can multiply the second row by -3/22:

```
[ 1  2/3 |  14/3 ]
[ 0  1   | -15/11 ]
```

Finally, we will make the element in the first row and second column equal to 0. To do this, we can subtract (2/3) times the second row from the first row:

```
[ 1  0 |  32/3 ]
[ 0  1 | -15/11 ]
```

Now, the matrix is in row-echelon form, and we can read the solution directly from the matrix:

x = 32/3
y = -15/11
